resources.string: Luxor Temple is an ode to the changing face of Egypt throughout the centuries.
"Of all Luxor's many monuments, the Karnak has to be its most astonishing and beautiful feat."
The Temple is magnificently situated at the foot of the sheer cliffs fringing the desert hills.
"One of the Nile Valley's most beautifully sited temples, It is dedicated to two gods."
"The Mortuary Temple of Seti I is dedicated to Amun and to the cult of the king's father Ramses I."
"One of Egypt's best museums, Luxor Museum holds a beautifully exhibited collection from the local area."
An Open Air Museum contains reconstructions of that have been dismantled inside the massive pylons.
Explains the processes behind the ancient Egyptian mummification in a series of well informative displays.
"If you haven't had your fill of tombs in the Valley of the Kings then make a beeline for the Nobles."
Within the valley are 63 tombs, which are a roll-call of famous names of Egyptian history.
The tombs mostly belong to the 19th and 20th dynasties. A total of almost 80 tombs are now known.
"Often gets overlooked on a West Bank trip, but this is one of Egypt's most beautifully decorated temples."
"The Home to a small temple, the remnants of a workers' village and the tombs of the workers themselves."
For great aerial views over the entire west bank, with its temples and village farmland in the escarpment.
"If you sail back just on sunset, you'll get to see the river at its most majestic."
Enjoy Nile Cruise from Luxor to Aswan, one of the best ways to see Egypt.
Al-Sahaby restaurant serves a variety of international and authentic Egyptian and Bedouin food.
The ambiance is soothing yet hip and cool. Thereâ€™s so many different rooms to suit your fancy.
Aisha Restaurant is just one of the fantastic sites in Luxor.
